attributes.action: Make affordable housing a reality for those who cannot buy a home by bringing back council housing which uses a fair rent system and to bring in measures to end the practice of selling off council/social housing to tenants at reduced prices.  This was originally a good idea but these homes are not being replaced like for like, and the expression "affordable housing" is merely that, most new developments do not contain "affordable housing" for those who are at minimum wage levels.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Many people are desparate for housing, and are unable to buy a home, even shared ownership schemes are unaffordable to thousands of homeless people.  Many people do not even want to buy a home, they do not want mortgages, why should they feel pressured in to buying.  More social housing needs to be built to give all people the chance to live in a decent home at a fair rent.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Make affordable housing a reality for those who cannot buy a home by bringing back council housing which uses a fair rent system and to bring in measures to end the practice of selling off council/social housing to tenants at reduced prices. This was originally a good idea but these homes are not being replaced like for like, and the expression "affordable housing" is merely that, most new developments do not contain "affordable housing" for those who are at minimum wage levels."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page17819
